Requirements: A completed online application, including fee. Transcripts from all universities attended. Three letters of recommendation. A resume. A statement of purpose outlining your academic interests and professional goals. Official GRE scores are optional for the M.A. in Film & Digital Media. GRE scores will not be used as a primary consideration in our review process. If you choose to submit GRE scores, please do not feel a need to study for the test. We simply do not emphasize these scores. We care more about who you are as a person and the interests you plan to pursue in your graduate work. A writing sample (e.g. term paper) of 10-20 pages. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. An undergraduate major in film, media studies, or a related discipline is recommended but not required. A minimum GPA of 3.0 is recommended.
Description: The Master of Arts in Film & Digital Media provides students with a theoretical and practical foundation for careers in film and digital media. The curriculum trains students to produce creative content, including narrative and documentary films, client-based media, web series, and other forms of digital media. Students also develop research and critical thinking skills as they learn about film history and media theory. The MA in Film & Digital Media prepares students for creative and professional careers in media production as well as for further study at the doctoral level.
AverageScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver and an $18,000 stipend

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Film and Digital Media
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. The minimum acceptable scores are 80 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), 6.5 on the IELTS, or 110 on the Duolingo English Test. A test score is required of all non-native English speakers unless they hold a bachelor's degree from a U.S.-accredited institution.
Requirements: Completed online application, including the application fee. The application includes the following: A personal statement: a 2-3 page essay that discusses the applicant's experience and interest in filmmaking as well as the applicant's reasons for wanting to attend Baylor for graduate studies. A creative portfolio: a link to a website with examples of the applicant's film, media arts, or other creative work that demonstrates a capacity for creative storytelling. Three letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae. Official transcripts from all institutions from which a degree was received.
Description: The Master of Fine Arts in Film & Digital Media is an intensive two-year program in which a select group of students are trained as writer/directors who will graduate with the professional, artistic, and intellectual acuity to create compelling narrative films. MFA students produce an original, festival-ready thesis film in their final year. Throughout the two years, they take a broad range of film production courses and advanced seminars in film history and theory. Graduate students are encouraged to take courses in other departments and have access to our wide range of professional-grade film equipment.
AverageScholarshipAmount: Full tuition scholarship plus a stipend
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition scholarship plus a stipend

ProgramName: Master of Science in Geosciences
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. The English proficiency exam requirement can be waived for applicants that have received a degree from an accredited U.S. institution. The required scores are: TOEFL iBT: 80, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 110.
Requirements: Completed online application and application fee, Official transcripts from all universities attended, Official GRE Scores (optional for applicants beginning in the Spring and Fall of 2024), 3 Letters of Recommendation, Statement of Purpose, Resume/Curriculum Vitae.
Description: The Department of Geosciences at Baylor University offers both the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. Our graduate program is thesis/dissertation-based and offers a low student-to-faculty ratio (2:1). With state-of-the-art facilities, our program provides a wide variety of research opportunities for graduate students. Faculty research areas are diverse and interdisciplinary, and we highly encourage collaborative research between students and faculty. As a result, Baylor graduate students have established a long tradition of producing and presenting high-quality research.

ProgramName: PhD in Geosciences
EnglishScore: All applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor prefers a score of 80 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), a score of 6.5 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test, or a score of 60 on the PTE.
Requirements: In addition to the general policies and requirements of the Graduate School, the following is required for the PhD program: Official Transcripts, GRE Scores (The GRE is not required for the PhD program), Purpose Statement (A statement of your background and goals, including research experience and interests), Resume or Curriculum Vitae (Required), Letters of Recommendation (Required: 3).
Description: The Department of Geosciences offers a PhD in Geosciences. The program prepares students for careers in academia, the energy and environmental industries, and government. We conduct research worldwide, from the Arctic to Antarctica. We are a dynamic, growing department of 14 tenured/tenure-track faculty and 2 full-time lecturers, approximately 50 undergraduates, and 40 graduate students. Our areas of emphasis in research and teaching are broad and include: Environmental Geosciences (climate change, hydrogeology, geophysics, paleoclimatology, biogeochemistry, contaminant transport), Tectonics & Sedimentology (basin analysis, structural geology, geophysics, tectonics, thermochronology, sedimentology, reservoir characterization), and Paleontology (paleoecology, vertebrate paleontology, paleobotany).

ProgramName: Master of Health Administration
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score to demonstrate English proficiency. The Graduate School's minimum score for the TOEFL is 80 on the iBT, the minimum for IELTS is 6.5, the minimum for PTE is 53, and the minimum for Duolingo is 110. Applicants may be exempt if they are a citizen of a specified country or have a bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited U.S. institution.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited US institution or a recognized international equivalent. While a specific major is not required, prerequisites in the areas of accounting, economics, and statistics are helpful. Application requirements include: Completed online application and fee; Official transcripts from every institution where a degree was earned and/or credit was received; Resume; Statement of Purpose: The statement of purpose should be 1-2 pages and explain why you have chosen the Baylor MHA program, your career objectives, and how an MHA degree will help you accomplish your goals; Three letters of recommendation; Official GRE or GMAT scores: Test scores are not required for applicants with a 3.0 undergraduate GPA or higher. We require test scores for all applicants with a GPA below 3.0.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: Baylor's residential Master of Health Administration (MHA) program is a professional degree for those seeking to lead and manage in a variety of health service organizations. Students in the Baylor MHA program are prepared for careers in hospitals, health systems, physician practices, consulting firms, and long-term care facilities. The program provides the opportunity for students to complement their classroom education with a seven-month, paid administrative residency. This distinctive feature of the program gives students invaluable experience and exceptional placement opportunities. Through the Baylor MHA program, students are equipped for a career that aligns with a calling to serve others through healthcare leadership.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Management Education (CAHME)

ProgramName: Master of Health Administration / Master of Business Administration Joint Degree
EnglishScore: All applicants who are not U.S. citizens and who do not hold a bachelor's degree or its equivalent from a U.S. institution must submit an official score report from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo.
Requirements:
Application to the Army-Baylor University MHA and MHA/MBA program is made through the Medical Operational Data System (MODS) website. The application requirements and process are explained in detail on the MODS website.

General Admission Requirements
- Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in the U.S. or proof of equivalent training in a foreign institution.
- Minimum GMAT score of 550 or GRE equivalent of 153 Verbal and 153 Quantitative
- Undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher.
- Favorable letters of recommendation from immediate supervisor, a previous professor and/or a senior healthcare executive.
- Structured interview with a senior faculty member of the Army-Baylor program.
- Personal statement addressing the applicant's goals and motivation for a career in federal healthcare.
- Favorable endorsement by a selection board of senior military officers and/or federal civilian executives.
- Relevant work experience is strongly recommended.
Description:
The Executive Clinical Leadership Track (ECL) is designed to prepare senior clinicians for leadership roles in fixed medical facilities, operational units, and at the strategic level of the Military Health System (MHS). This 24-month program leads to a dual Master of Health Administration (MHA) and Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree from Baylor University.

Program Goals
Graduates of the Executive Clinical Leadership Track are able to:
- Integrate foundational business and healthcare management disciplines to resolve complex organizational problems in a variety of healthcare settings.
- Think critically to solve problems and make sound leadership and management decisions.
- Effectively communicate to a wide range of audiences using a variety of communication methods.
- Develop and lead others in a way that reflects values of integrity, service, and excellence.
- Create innovative solutions to challenges across the Military Health System.
Accredidation: The Army-Baylor University MHA degree program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Management Education (CAHME). The Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business for both its business and accounting programs.

ProgramName: PhD in Health Services
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a test score demonstrating their English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (recommended minimum 80 iBT or 550 pBT), IELTS (recommended minimum 6.5), or Duolingo (recommended minimum 110).
Description: The PhD in Health Services Research is designed for students seeking careers in health services research in academic, government, corporate or consulting organizations. The program has three distinct pillars with a comprehensive curriculum to train scholars in health services research. The program is unique in its integration within a business school and its strong emphasis on developing scholars with a deep understanding of health economics, health policy and management and their intersection in the development of a highly reliable health system. Baylor University’s PhD in Health Services Research, offered through the Department of Economics in the Hankamer School of Business, prepares graduates for a career in academia, government or industry. Students will develop a rich understanding of one of these areas, depending on their interests: Health Services Research, Health Policy & Management, Health Economics. The curriculum is delivered in a face-to-face format on Baylor's campus in Waco, Texas. Students complete the program in four to five years.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Education in Higher Education and Student Affairs
EnglishScore: International applicants who are not citizens of a country on the list of English-speaking countries must submit a test score to demonstrate English proficiency. Baylor accepts the TOEFL (minimum iBT score of 80, paper-based score of 550), the IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), or the Duolingo (minimum score of 110).
Requirements:
Complete online application. Please note: Once you have submitted your application, you will not be able to go back and make changes.
Official transcripts from all colleges/universities you have attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
Statement of Purpose. A 2-3 page, double-spaced essay describing why you want to be a student affairs professional, what has led you to this decision, and how Baylor’s HESA program will help you achieve your professional goals.
Resume.
The GRE is not required for admission into the HESA program.
The application fee is $50. We offer application fee waivers to veterans and McNair Scholars.
Description:
The Master of Science in Education (MSEd) in Higher Education and Student Affairs (HESA) is a full-time, two-year graduate program that prepares students for careers in student affairs, academic affairs, and other administrative areas of higher education. The Baylor HESA program emphasizes the integration of faith and learning, and it is built upon the foundational principles of a Christian mission in a caring community.

The HESA program operates on a cohort model, where students enter and proceed through the program together. Most classes have an enrollment of 10-15 students, which fosters close relationships among students and faculty. Students have ample opportunities for mentoring from faculty and administrators, research experience with faculty, and professional development and networking on and off campus.

Graduates from the HESA program have found success in obtaining jobs in various offices on college campuses including student activities, admissions, academic advising, career services, multicultural affairs, residence life, financial aid, and new student programs. Students have found jobs at institutions such as Baylor University, Duke University, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Texas A&M University, Southern Methodist University, Texas Christian University, the University of Oklahoma, and Oklahoma State University.

ProgramName: PhD in Higher Education Studies & Leadership
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of these tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo. Minimum scores are 80 on the TOEFL iBT (550 on pBT), 6.5 on IELTS, 60 on PTE, or 115 on Duolingo.
Description: The PhD in Higher Education Studies and Leadership (HESL) is an intensive program of study designed to prepare individuals for faculty and administrative leadership positions in colleges and universities as well as for positions in higher education-related agencies, boards, and commissions. The program is specifically designed to provide students with significant grounding in higher education literature, theory, and research. Students will study curriculum with a cohort and gain significant knowledge and skills in organizational theory, governance and finance, student development, legal issues, and teaching and learning. Additionally, students are able to customize their studies through elective coursework, cognate studies, and dissertation research.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition remission and a stipend

ProgramName: Master of Arts in History
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit scores from either the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo exam.
Requirements: The History Department begins accepting applications on September 1 for the following academic year. The deadline for applications is January 15. Your application must be complete by that date in order to receive full consideration for admission and financial aid. A completed application includes an application fee, official transcripts, a statement of purpose, a resume/CV, a writing sample, and three letters of recommendation.
Concentration: United States history, European history, history of Religion, World History
Description: The M.A. program in History provides students with an introduction to the professional study of history and equips them with basic research and analytical skills in the discipline. The M.A. in History is not a terminal degree program, and as such we give strong preference in admissions to students who plan to continue in the Ph.D. program at Baylor. However, the M.A. program serves those who plan to teach history at the secondary level, work in public history, or enter a number of other professions. We accept M.A. applications in United States history, European history, and the history of Religion and we offer a separate concentration in World History.

ProgramName: PhD in History
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor Graduate School accepts scores from TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), and Duolingo (minimum 110). An applicant may be exempt from the English proficiency requirement if they are a citizen of certain countries or if they have a bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution.
Requirements: A complete application will consist of the following items: Completed online application through the Graduate School (GoApplyTexas); A statement of purpose indicating the applicant’s proposed major field, special interests, and professional goals; A writing sample of no more than 30 pages that best demonstrates the student's historical skills, typically a research paper; All undergraduate and graduate transcripts; Three letters of recommendation from former professors that testify to the student's scholarly potential.
Fees: All students admitted to the Ph.D. program in History receive a generous funding package that includes a full tuition waiver and an annual stipend for five years.
Concentration: History of the Americas, History of Early Modern Europe, History of Modern Europe, World History
Description: The Baylor PhD program in History provides students with a vibrant and supportive intellectual community. Our faculty have published widely and are highly respected in their fields. Graduate students have the opportunity to work closely with their faculty mentors in small seminars and one-on-one tutorials. The program’s curriculum is flexible, designed to allow each student to tailor a course of study to fit their intellectual interests and professional goals. We take pride in our success in preparing students for a variety of careers. Our students have an excellent record of winning prestigious fellowships, publishing their work, and securing academic positions. We are committed to funding our students through five years of study. Our standard funding package includes full tuition remission, a generous stipend, and subsidized health insurance. The Baylor History PhD program offers comprehensive study in the following fields: History of the Americas, History of Early Modern Europe, History of Modern Europe, World History.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Systems
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from one of the following tests to demonstrate English proficiency: a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 80, a minimum IELTS overall score of 6.5, a minimum PTE score of 60, or a minimum Duolingo score of 110.
Requirements:
A completed online application and application fee are required. In addition, applicants must submit the following:
*   Official transcripts from all institutions from which a degree was received. For review purposes, unofficial transcripts may be uploaded with your application. Official transcripts are required upon admission.
*   Official GMAT or GRE score. A waiver is available for qualifying applicants. See the MSIS webpage for waiver qualifications.
*   Resume or curriculum vitae.
*   Two letters of recommendation.
*   Statement of Purpose. Please provide a statement (500-1000 words) addressing the following:
    *   Your motivation for pursuing the MSIS degree.
    *   How will this degree help you achieve your career goals?
    *   What are your specific interests within the program?
    *   What makes you a good fit for Baylor's MSIS program?
*   For international applicants: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo scores may be required.
Description: The Master of Science in Information Systems (MSIS) degree is offered by the Department of Information Systems and Business Analytics in the Hankamer School of Business. It is a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) designated program designed to provide students with a strong foundation of technical skills and business knowledge to become leaders in the rapidly growing information systems field. The program is flexible to accommodate students from various undergraduate backgrounds. The MSIS program prepares students for careers in the areas of business analytics, information technology, and cyber security. Students may select a concentration in cyber security or a general MSIS degree. Students develop both their analytical and problem-solving skills to manage and leverage information systems in the workplace. We equip students with the necessary skills to develop secure information systems and analyze data for business decision-making. We emphasize hands-on and experiential learning by incorporating real-world projects in our courses. We also provide ample opportunities for students to meet with professionals from leading companies in our classes as well as through seminars and career fairs.
Accredidation: The Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accreditation agency for business schools.

ProgramName: PhD in Information Systems
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from an approved test of English proficiency. This requirement will be waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S. institution. Approved tests include the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), and Duolingo. Baylor’s ETS code for score reporting is 6032. We require a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (iBT), a minimum overall IELTS score of 6.5, or a minimum Duolingo score of 110. Scores should not be more than two years old.
Requirements: Three letters of recommendation are required from people who are in a position to evaluate your academic performance and potential. At least two letters should be from your former professors. A statement of purpose of about 500 words is required. The statement should describe your motivation for seeking a Ph.D. in IS, research interests, and career goals. If you have had any research experiences, please summarize them in the statement. Submit a current resume or curriculum vitae listing your education, work and research experience, publications, and other honors and accomplishments. The GMAT or GRE is required. An unofficial test score report is sufficient for the application. Official score reports will be required if an admission offer is made.
Fees: Full tuition remission is provided to all admitted students
Description: The PhD program in Information Systems (IS) at Baylor’s Hankamer School of Business will prepare you for a career as a productive researcher and an effective teacher in a university setting. We train our graduates to excel in academia as professors at leading research institutions. We recognize that the value of an IS PhD degree depends heavily upon a graduate’s initial placement and long-term professional development. Therefore, our program provides significant faculty support and other resources to ensure student success on the job market and throughout their careers. Our PhD program provides many distinct advantages for a student seeking an academic career. For example, all admitted students are fully funded with a competitive stipend and their tuition is waived. In addition, the program has a strong placement record at leading research universities in the United States and abroad. As an R1-designated university, our faculty publish in premier journals, offering students excellent opportunities for research collaboration.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an English proficiency score. Citizens of countries on our exemption list are waived from this requirement.
Description: The Master of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies allows students to customize a graduate program that suits their particular interests and needs. This program allows students to select three areas of study to combine in a way that creates a unique and personalized learning experience. The MSIS can be particularly attractive to those who have undergraduate degrees in a professional or technical area and seek advanced training in areas such as management, communication or leadership.

ProgramName: Master of International Journalism
EnglishScore: International students who do not have a degree from an American university also must submit a satisfactory TOEFL score. The Graduate School requires a minimum TOEFL score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), a minimum overall score of 6.5 on the IELTS, or a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test for applicants whose native language is not English.
Requirements: Applications for the M.I.J. are accepted from students with bachelor’s degrees in any field of study. The M.I.J. program values diversity and encourages applications from women and students from underrepresented groups and developing countries. To be eligible for admission to the Master of International Journalism program, a student must have an acceptable bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. The online application includes a statement of purpose, three letters of recommendation, and a resume.
Description: The Master of International Journalism (M.I.J.) degree is designed for students who want to become journalists with a global perspective. The program focuses on journalistic practice within a strong scholarly framework. It prepares students for careers in international journalism in the United States and abroad. Students develop reporting skills across media platforms along with a critical understanding of the historical, political, economic and cultural contexts of global media. In addition to rigorous coursework, students complete a professional project, such as a substantial piece of journalistic work or a research-based project on a topic in international media. The degree also requires an internship or professional experience in an international setting.
ScholarshipType: Fellowships, University Scholarships, Departmental Scholarships, Assistantships

ProgramName: Master of Arts in International Relations (Political Science)
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens and who have not received a degree from a U.S. institution are required to take an English proficiency exam. Baylor accepts the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo. The recommended minimum score for the TOEFL iBT is 80, 6.5 for the IELTS, and 110 for Duolingo.
Requirements:
The following are required for an application to the MA in International Relations program:

Completed online application through the Graduate School
Official transcripts from all universities attended
Three letters of recommendation
Statement of purpose
A writing sample (10-25 pages)
An Application Fee of $50 (domestic) and $50 (international).

GRE scores are not required.
Description: The Master of Arts in International Relations (MAIR) program provides students with a solid foundation for careers in the U.S. government, the private sector, and nonprofit organizations devoted to international affairs. In recent years, Baylor MAIR graduates have found jobs with the Central Intelligence Agency, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the U.S. Department of State, the U.S. Agency for International Development, the U.S. Congress, and other federal government agencies. Some go to work for “Beltway bandit” consulting firms that assist the U.S. government with national security matters. Some find jobs in the private sector with firms that conduct international business. Some go on to doctoral programs and academic careers. The MAIR degree can be completed in approximately 18 months. It requires 36 hours of coursework. All students must take a required core curriculum of 12 hours: PSC 5310 Seminar in International Relations, PSC 5320 Seminar in American Foreign Policy, PSC 5331 International Relations in the Developing World, and PSC 5340 National Security Policy. Students complete their remaining hours with a combination of additional international relations courses, courses in other political science subfields, courses from other Baylor departments, and an optional thesis. Many students choose to specialize in a particular region of the world (e.g., the Middle East) or a particular issue area (e.g., international economic policy).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Journalism, Public Relations and New Media
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit one of the following scores to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL (a score of 80 on the iBT), IELTS (a score of 6.5), or the Duolingo English Test (DET) (a score of 110). The English proficiency test requirement is waived if the applicant holds a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S.-accredited institution.
Description: The Master of Arts in Journalism, Public Relations & New Media is a one-year program that prepares recent graduates or returning professionals to excel in a rapidly changing media world. The program provides an intensive, hands-on experience, and students can choose between a professional or thesis track. The professional track is designed for students who desire to learn practical and professional skills and is the most common choice for M.A. students. The thesis track is designed for students who want to develop research skills and potentially prepare for doctoral studies. Regardless of track, M.A. students take foundational courses on media theory, research and ethics before delving into more practical skills classes. At the end of the first semester, students identify a focus area that could include such topics as sports media, public relations, visual storytelling or literary journalism. From there, students tailor their course schedule to match their professional goals. They also work closely with faculty members on professional projects and research. The goal of the graduate program in journalism is to create master storytellers who can work as professionals in a number of communications fields or as scholars in academia.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC)
ScholarshipType: Graduate assistantships, Stipends, Tuition coverage/waivers, Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Learning Design and Technology
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an English proficiency score. We accept the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo. Citizens of countries on the English Proficiency Waiver List are exempt.
Requirements: An earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. Minimum 3.0 overall GPA on a 4.0 scale. The Graduate School application. Official transcripts from all institutions from which a degree was received. An application fee. A current résumé that summarizes your professional and educational history. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate your potential for graduate study. A written Statement of Purpose that explains your rationale for applying for this program and how completing the degree will facilitate your personal and professional goals. A recorded interview. The GRE is not required.
Description: The Master of Science in Education (MSEd) in Learning Design and Technology (LDT) is designed for professionals who desire to be educational leaders and innovators in a variety of contexts, including P-12 education, higher education, corporate training, non-profit, military, and government settings. The program equips students with the knowledge and skills necessary to design, develop, implement, and evaluate effective and engaging learning experiences using a wide range of technologies and pedagogical strategies. Graduates will be prepared to assume roles such as instructional designers, educational technologists, curriculum specialists, training managers, and online learning specialists.

ProgramName: Certificate in Learning Design and Technology
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. This is a university-wide requirement which can be satisfied by holding a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. accredited institution or by submitting acceptable scores from the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: The application requires the following: Online application and application fee, Official transcripts from every institution where a student has taken 60 or more credit hours, Resume or Curriculum Vitae, Statement of Purpose, Two letters of recommendation
Description: The Certificate in Learning Design and Technology (LDT) is designed to provide professional development for K-12 teachers, instructional designers, technology coordinators, higher education professionals, corporate trainers, and others who wish to incorporate technology and digital resources into their teaching and training. This 12-hour certificate program may be completed in two semesters or longer.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Marriage & Family Therapy
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency by submitting a satisfactory score on the TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE exam. Minimum scores are 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 110 on the Duolingo, or 60 on the PTE.
Requirements: A completed online application; Transcripts from all schools from which you have earned credit; Statement of Purpose; Resume or Curriculum Vitae; 3 Letters of Recommendation; Interview: Finalists will be selected for interviews with faculty.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description:
The Master of Science in Marriage and Family Therapy (MFT) is a 60 hour program that prepares students for licensure in Texas as a Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT). The mission of the Master of Science in Marriage and Family Therapy program is to train relationally-minded scholars and therapists for service to diverse individuals, couples, and families through contextually-informed and evidence-based practice.
Students will learn from faculty who are productive scholars in the field of marriage and family therapy as well as experienced clinicians and supervisors. The program prepares students to become scientist-practitioners who appreciate the role of research in informing clinical practice and the role of practice in informing research.
The MFT program can be completed in two years. During the first year, students take academic courses and begin to develop clinical skills at the Baylor Couple and Family Therapy Clinic, our on-campus training facility. During the second year, students continue their academic coursework and are placed in community agencies to continue their clinical training.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Marriage and Family Therapy Program at Baylor University is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Marriage and Family Therapy Education (COAMFTE) of the American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy (AAMFT), 112 South Alfred Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314, (703) 838-9808, coa@aamft.org.

ProgramName: PhD in Materials Science & Engineering
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing a satisfactory score on the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test.
Requirements:
Completed online application, which includes:

- 3 letters of recommendation
- Statement of Purpose
- Resume or CV
- Transcripts from all schools attended

Official GRE scores are recommended. Baylor's ETS code is 6032.
Description:
The Ph.D. in Materials Science and Engineering is an interdisciplinary program designed to equip students with a deep understanding of materials science and engineering principles, preparing them for careers in academia, industry, and national laboratories. This program is housed in the Baylor University School of Engineering and Computer Science (ECS) and is administered through the Materials Science and Engineering program within ECS. It leverages the expertise and research capabilities of faculty from various departments, including Mechanical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, and Geosciences.

The Ph.D. program in Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) is designed to provide students with a comprehensive, interdisciplinary education and research experience in the field of materials. The curriculum is structured to offer a strong foundation in materials science fundamentals, followed by specialized coursework and in-depth research in a chosen area of interest. Students in the program will engage in cutting-edge research projects, working closely with faculty mentors who are leaders in their respective fields. The research-intensive nature of the program aims to develop independent researchers capable of addressing complex challenges in materials science and engineering.

Students will have access to state-of-the-art research facilities and laboratories, fostering a collaborative and innovative research environment. The program encourages interdisciplinary collaboration, allowing students to work on projects that span multiple scientific and engineering disciplines. Graduates of the Ph.D. program will be well-prepared for careers in academia, industrial research and development, and government laboratories, with the skills and knowledge to make significant contributions to the field of materials science and engineering.
AverageScholarshipAmount: The majority of Ph.D. students receive tuition remission as well as a competitive stipend. In the 2023-2024 academic year, the stipend amount is $28,000 for 12 months.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Materials Science and Engineering
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo.
Description: The Master of Science in Materials Science and Engineering is a research-based master's degree that prepares students to enter a PhD program or for a career as a research and development engineer. This program is for students who want to develop strong fundamentals in material science through in-depth coursework and a rigorous research experience. The program provides an option to concentrate in a specific area of materials.

ProgramName: PhD in Mathematics
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from an English proficiency exam. The acceptable exams are TOEFL iBT (minimum 80), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 110), or PTE (minimum 60).
Requirements: Applicants to the Ph.D. program in Mathematics are evaluated on an individual basis. To be considered for admission, applicants must satisfy the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School and must also be recommended by the Mathematics Department. In general, an applicant for the Ph.D. in mathematics should have completed with distinction the equivalent of an undergraduate major in mathematics. The application and all supporting documents must be submitted online.
Description:
Our department has a thriving and active graduate program leading to both the M.A. and Ph.D. degrees in mathematics. Our aim is to develop mathematicians who are both outstanding researchers and excellent teachers. Our faculty are dedicated to these goals. For our Ph.D. students, our graduate program has a strong track record for placing our graduates in academic positions at a variety of colleges and universities. We are small enough to give our graduate students individual attention, yet large enough to have active research programs in several areas of algebra, analysis, differential equations, mathematical physics, numerical analysis, representation theory and topology.
The Department of Mathematics offers a program of study leading to the Doctor of Philosophy degree. The primary goal of the Ph.D. program is to train students to become excellent researchers and teachers of mathematics. Students entering this program will choose an area of research in either pure or applied mathematics and will work closely with a faculty member. The Ph.D. program requires a minimum of 78 hours of graduate work, including at least 48 hours of graduate-level course work and at least 12 hours of dissertation credit. Each student's program of study is designed in conjunction with a faculty advisor.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends of at least $22,000 per year; Fellowships with $30,000 per year stipend.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (Online)
Requirements:
Application requirements include:
- Application and fee
- Transcripts
- Resume
- Essay Question
- Letters of Recommendation
- Official Test Scores (The GMAT/GRE requirement may be waived for qualified applicants.)
Concentration: ['Cybersecurity', 'Executive Communication', 'Global Trade and Supply Chain Management']
Description: The Baylor Online MBA is designed for working professionals who desire to earn their MBA from a nationally-acclaimed institution with a distinct mission. The curriculum emphasizes strategic decision-making, leadership, and management with purpose. The Baylor Online MBA provides a rigorous learning experience for students with an average of eight years of work experience. The degree can be completed in as little as 12 months. Our distinguished faculty, challenging curriculum and connected network are just a few of the reasons to choose Baylor for your MBA.
Accredidation: The Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for business schools. This "gold standard" is held by less than five percent of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (Waco, Full-Time)
EnglishScore: Baylor University requires that applicants whose native language is not English demonstrate a required level of English proficiency. Baylor accepts the TOEFL, IELTS, and DuoLingo tests. Recommended scores are 80 on the iBT, 550 on the PBT, 6.5 on IELTS, and 110 on DuoLingo. Successful completion of Level 112 of the English for Academic Purposes program at an ELS Language Center also fulfills this requirement.
Concentration: ['Business Analytics', 'Cyber Security', 'Economics', 'Entrepreneurship and Corporate Innovation', 'Finance', 'Healthcare Administration', 'Information Systems and Management', 'International Business', 'Marketing', 'Supply Chain Management']
Description: The Baylor MBA full-time program is designed for early-career professionals who want to accelerate their career or pivot to a new one. The 53-hour curriculum can be completed in as few as 16 months and up to 21 months. Students are encouraged to tailor their degree to fit their professional goals with a robust curriculum of elective courses and 10 concentrations from which to choose. Students learn valuable leadership skills in a collaborative, team-based environment and are encouraged to put their knowledge into practice through case studies, client-based projects and consulting opportunities.
Accredidation: Baylor University's Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
ScholarshipAmount: Varying amounts up to full tuition

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Cyber Security (Online)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from an English proficiency test. Baylor accepts scores from the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test. An alternative to these tests is to successfully complete Level 112 of the Intensive English Program at an ELS Language Center.
Description: Baylor’s Online Master of Business Administration (MBA) program is designed for working professionals who want a top-ranked, Christian-focused education that will help them achieve their career goals. We bring our nationally acclaimed MBA program online in a flexible format that allows students to continue their careers while pursuing their degrees. The Baylor Online MBA program provides a rigorous learning experience taught by the same Christian faculty as our on-campus programs. Through our curriculum, you will develop advanced business skills in areas such as accounting, finance, management, and marketing. You will also have the opportunity to concentrate your degree in a specific area of business, including cyber security, executive communication, or marketing.
Accredidation: Baylor University’s Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International, which represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than 5 percent of the world’s business programs have earned this distinction.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Executive Communication (Online)
EnglishScore: All applicants who are not U.S. Citizens must submit a score from an English Proficiency exam. We currently accept the following exams: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, and DuoLingo. The Graduate School requires a minimum TOEFL score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (pBT). The Graduate School requires a minimum IELTS score of 6.5. The Graduate School requires a minimum PTE score of 60. The Graduate School requires a minimum DuoLingo score of 110. An applicant is exempt from the English proficiency exam if they are a citizen of a country found on the exemption list or have a bachelor's degree from a U.S. accredited institution.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission into the Baylor Online MBA program, you will need to submit the following:
- Online Application
- Resume: Submit a current resume detailing your professional experience, skills and accomplishments.
- Transcripts: Submit official transcripts from all colleges or universities you have attended.
- Two Letters of Recommendation: Submit two professional letters of recommendation. Letters should address your career progression, intellectual abilities, and leadership potential. The most useful recommendations come from those who have supervised your work.
- Two Essays: Submit two essays describing why you are an ideal candidate for Baylor’s Online MBA program. Use your essays to showcase your writing skills, unique qualities, and professional and personal ambitions.
- GMAT/GRE Scores: Applicants must submit GMAT or GRE scores to be considered for admission to the Baylor Online MBA program. GMAT/GRE waivers are available for qualified applicants who meet certain criteria. Waivers are not guaranteed and are reviewed on a case-by-case basis.
- Application Fee
Description: The Baylor University Online MBA with a concentration in Executive Communication goes beyond theory to focus on practical strategies and techniques for effective corporate communication. Learn from the same distinguished faculty who teach in our on-campus programs. We designed this corporate communication degree with a rigorous curriculum to challenge and prepare you to become a leader of influence in any organization. The Executive Communication concentration within our online MBA program consists of 12 credit hours. You will learn to do the following: Develop communication strategies for internal and external stakeholders. Leverage social media and other technologies in a communication strategy. Use effective communication techniques for crisis management. Lead and communicate change within an organization. Throughout the program, you will learn to apply the necessary communication strategies to successfully navigate corporate settings and guide your organization through any business situation.
Accredidation: Baylor's Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International, which is the most prestigious accreditation for business schools. Less than 5 percent of business schools worldwide have AACSB accreditation, and we are one of the 10 percent of AACSB-accredited schools that also holds a separate accreditation for our accounting program.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Global Trade & Supply Chain Management (Online)
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor accepts the following tests: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT) or 550 (pBT); IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5; PTE with a minimum score of 60; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 110. Successful completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Center's English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program is also accepted.
Description: Baylor's Online MBA in Global Trade and Supply Chain Management prepares students for executive-level roles in the complex and dynamic fields of international commerce and logistics. The program's curriculum emphasizes ethical leadership, data-informed decision making and strategic management. Students in the program develop the knowledge and skills necessary to improve organizational performance through the orchestration of an efficient, agile and adaptable global supply chain.
Accredidation: Baylor University's Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business) for business and accounting.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Healthcare Administration
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit a score from a recent (within two years) TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo exam.
Description: The Robbins MBA Healthcare Program prepares leaders to be on the forefront of the healthcare industry. Our nationally-ranked curriculum is uniquely focused on experiential learning and professional development. With a business core curriculum, specialized healthcare classes, a seven-month paid Executive Residency and an administrative fellowship, our students graduate with the skills and confidence to lead a variety of healthcare organizations.
Accredidation: The MBA Healthcare Administration program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Management Education (CAHME) and the Hankamer School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Marketing (Online)
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is required. The TOEFL score must be at least 100 on the iBT. The IELTS score must be at least a 7.0. Applicants are exempt from the TOEFL/IELTS requirement if they hold a bachelor's degree or any graduate degree from an academic institution in the United States, or from a country where English is the official language.
Description: The Baylor Online MBA is designed for working professionals who want a top-ranked, nationally-acclaimed MBA degree from a Tier 1 university with AACSB accreditation. Our online format allows you to earn your MBA in as little as 12 months without career interruption. You will learn from the same Christian faculty who teach in our residential MBA programs and engage in a rigorous, relevant curriculum that builds upon your experience. The supportive, collaborative environment will equip you with the skills needed to lead with integrity and purpose.
Accredidation: AACSB International

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: For international applicants, Baylor accepts scores from the TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum 110) to demonstrate English proficiency. Waivers may be available for students who have completed a bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution or a degree from an institution in an English-speaking country.
Description:
The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) degree program offers graduate students an opportunity to strengthen their technical skills for the challenges they will encounter in their professional careers. It also serves as a path to pursuing doctoral studies. The graduate curriculum is flexible to allow a student to design a degree plan that fits their specific research interests. A graduate student can elect to focus their thesis research and coursework in one of three areas:

Biomechanical
Materials
Thermal-Fluid Sciences
ScholarshipPercentage: Up to 100% tuition waiver for assistantships

ProgramName: PhD in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: For international applicants, one of the following official scores is required: a minimum TOEFL score of 80, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, or a minimum Duolingo score of 110. An exemption may be available for applicants who have received a degree from a U.S. institution or an institution in a country where English is the native language.
Description: The PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering provides students with an opportunity to demonstrate the ability to make a significant and original contribution to the field of mechanical engineering. The primary areas of emphasis are thermofluid sciences, design and manufacturing, and materials science. The program is designed to create a culture of research and discovery and to prepare students for successful careers in industry, research, or academia. Students are encouraged to contact a Mechanical Engineering Graduate Faculty member in their area of interest for more information.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Medical Science
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. This requirement is waived for students who have a degree from a U.S. institution.
Requirements:
The following prerequisite coursework is highly recommended. Prerequisite course work should be completed at the time of application. Students may apply with one or two prerequisites in progress, but all prerequisites must be completed before matriculation into the program.
* Biology: Two semesters of biology with labs (for science majors).
* Chemistry: Two semesters of general chemistry with labs (for science majors).
* Chemistry: Two semesters of organic chemistry with labs (for science majors).
* Biochemistry: One semester of biochemistry. A lab is not required.
* Physics: Two semesters of physics with labs.
* Mathematics: One semester of statistics.
Description: The Master of Science in Medical Science (MSMS) program is a specialized one-year master's program designed to provide students with a broad-based one-year curriculum in the medical sciences while strengthening their credentials for admission into medical school or other health professional programs. The MSMS program emphasizes the development of critical thinking skills, problem solving, and the acquisition of a knowledge base in the foundational medical sciences. The curriculum consists of 36 credit hours of graduate-level coursework taken over a 12-month period. Students take courses alongside the first-year medical students for the majority of the curriculum including Medical Gross Anatomy and Embryology, Medical Physiology, Medical Neuroscience, Medical Biochemistry and Genetics, and Medical Histology and Cell Biology. There are other courses that have been developed exclusively for the MSMS students including Link to Clinical Medicine, Critical Appraisal of the Medical Literature, and Professional Development in the Health Sciences. The program will also offer workshops, advising, and professional development to prepare students to succeed in the rigorous application process to medical school and other health professional programs. The Medical Sciences Program will equip students to be more successful in gaining admission into, and completing, a medical school curriculum.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Museum Studies
EnglishScore: All applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an English proficiency score. For those holding U.S. citizenship or who are a U.S. Permanent Resident, this requirement is waived. Baylor University Graduate School requires that applicants whose native language is not English submit a test score to demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, and ELS Level 112.
Requirements: The Graduate School requires an earned bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution. Complete the online application and pay the $50 application fee. Transcripts: Unofficial transcripts are sufficient for the application review process. Applicants must submit an official transcript after being admitted. Letters of Recommendation: 3. Statement of Purpose: A statement of purpose is a brief statement, about 500 words, that describes your academic interests and explains why you want to pursue graduate studies in museum studies at Baylor. Writing Sample: A writing sample must be submitted. It should be a single-authored work, fully cited, and no longer than 25 pages (double-spaced). Resume: A professional resume or CV is required. Standardized Test Scores: No test is required (GRE, GMAT, etc.). International Applicants: Please check the international applicant requirements for any additional requirements.
Description: The Master of Arts in Museum Studies program offers students an interdisciplinary course of study that combines research, practice, and critical theory. The program focuses on training well-rounded museum professionals who have hands-on experience in a variety of museum settings. Through core coursework and elective seminars, students are trained in the practical and theoretical aspects of museum work. Internships and a thesis or professional project provide practical, real-world experience. Graduates of our program are competitive in the museum job market and are well-prepared for a variety of careers in the field.

ProgramName: Master of Music in Music Theory
EnglishScore: All international applicants whose native language is not English must submit a satisfactory score on an English proficiency exam. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 110, PTE: 53.
Requirements: In addition to the general Baylor Graduate School requirements, this program requires: Official transcripts from all universities attended. Application fee. Three letters of recommendation. Curriculum Vitae or Resume. Statement of Purpose. Writing Sample: Please submit 2-3 scholarly papers on a musical topic. GRE: General test is not required. Interview: Not required. School of Music Application: Must be submitted. Pre-screening materials: Please consult the School of Music website for specific requirements. Audition: Not Required
Description: The Master of Music in Music Theory provides advanced study in music theory, analysis, history of theory, Schenkerian analysis, post-tonal theory, and pedagogy of theory. The degree culminates in the writing and defense of a master’s thesis.

ProgramName: Master of Music in Musicology
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an English proficiency score. Citizens of countries on our exemption list do not need to submit a test score. Baylor accepts TOEFL, IELTS, and DuoLingo test scores.
Description: The Master of Music in Musicology is a research-oriented degree that prepares students for doctoral study and for a variety of other career paths. We offer a comprehensive and rigorous two-year program of study that surveys the history of Western music and its methodologies, culminating in a master’s thesis. Faculty research interests are wide-ranging and include early modern music and culture, German modernism, music and religion, music and politics, and popular music. Students are encouraged to develop their own research interests and pursuits under the guidance of our faculty. All students take a sequence of courses in music history and its research methods, as well as a specified number of electives in music theory or other areas of music that are tailored to the student’s interests and background. In the second year of study, each student writes a thesis on a research topic of their choice. The thesis is a substantial work of scholarship that is written in consultation with a faculty advisor. Recent thesis topics have covered a diverse range of topics, including the music of Hildegard von Bingen, the nineteenth-century reception of J.S. Bach, the player piano in America, sacred music in the films of the Dardenne brothers, and the role of nostalgia in the music of the rock band Radiohead.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is a member of the National Association of Schools of Music and the Texas Association of Music Schools. The university is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Neonatal Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: The Graduate School requires international applicants to take an English proficiency exam unless they are exempt. The minimum required scores are 80 for TOEFL iBT, 6.5 for IELTS, or 110 for Duolingo.
Requirements: Applicants must meet all requirements for the Baylor University Graduate School. A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum of two years, full-time RN practice experience (or the part-time equivalent) within the last five years in a Level III or IV Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is required prior to the clinical portion of the program. Current unencumbered RN license to practice in the United States. A 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA is recommended for all previous academic work. Complete an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better. Neonatal Resuscitation Program (NRP) and Basic Life Support (BLS) certification must be obtained prior to the first clinical course and maintained throughout the program. The GRE is not required for admission to the DNP-NNP program. Additional application materials include the online application and fee, official transcripts, a current resume or curriculum vitae, three letters of recommendation, a personal statement, and a video essay.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Nurse-Midwifery
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the online DNP-NM program, you must meet the following criteria: A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale on all prior academic work (including BSN and any graduate degrees). At least one year of full-time RN experience by the application deadline. A current, unencumbered RN license that is valid in your state of residence. Successful completion of a three-credit, upper-division statistics course with a grade of “C” or better.
Description:
The online Doctor of Nursing Practice – Nurse-Midwifery (DNP-NM) program, offered through the Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing, prepares registered nurses (BSN or MSN) to become nurse-midwives and leaders in their field. The DNP-NM program focuses on clinical practice, leadership, and evidence-based care for women across their lifespan. Graduates will be prepared to provide care during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period, as well as gynecologic and primary care to women from adolescence through menopause.

As a student in the online DNP-NM program, you will learn to:

- Provide full-scope midwifery care, including prenatal, labor and birth, postpartum, and newborn care.
- Manage common gynecologic and primary health conditions in women.
- Develop and implement evidence-based practice guidelines to improve patient outcomes.
- Advocate for policies that promote health equity and access to care for women and families.
- Lead interprofessional teams to enhance the quality and safety of health care delivery.
Accredidation:
The Doctor of Nursing Practice degree program at Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

The Nurse-Midwifery track is also accredited by the Accreditation Commission for Midwifery Education (ACME), 2000 Duke Street, Suite 300, Alexandria, VA 22314, Tel: (703) 835-4565, support@theacme.org, www.theacme.org.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nutrition
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit an English proficiency exam score. We accept TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo. The English proficiency exam requirement is waived if the applicant holds a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. accredited institution.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (MS) degree in Nutrition Sciences requires the successful completion of 36 hours of graduate coursework, of which 18 hours must be 5000-level courses. The MS degree in Nutrition Sciences has two different tracks: Thesis or Non-Thesis. Both tracks require the same core courses: NTR 5323, NTR 5330, NTR 5340, NTR 5350, and NTR 5360. In addition, students in both tracks take three hours of statistics (STA 5300 or approved substitute), and six hours of supporting coursework. The remaining coursework consists of six hours of thesis for students in the thesis track (NTR 5V99), or six hours of electives for students in the non-thesis track. Thesis track students must orally defend their thesis and non-thesis track students must pass a final oral examination.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nutrition Sciences
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This may be accomplished in several ways: 1. Earned a bachelor's degree from a U.S. institution or from a country on our approved list. 2. Submitted an official TOEFL score of 80 or higher. 3. Submitted an official IELTS score of 6.5 or higher. 4. Submitted an official Duolingo score of 110 or higher. 5. Submitted an official PTE score of 60 or higher. 6. Completed all levels of the ELS Language Center's English for Academic Purposes program with a score of 3.5 on the exit exam.
Requirements: Admission to the program is based on the student's undergraduate preparation and academic record, GRE score, recommendations, and personal statement of purpose. In addition to the requirements of the Graduate School, applicants must have a minimum of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the academic requirements of the Graduate School. A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission. Applicants who have completed the Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD) from an ACEND-accredited institution will be considered to have met the course prerequisites for the program. A minimum of one course in each of the following areas: general chemistry, organic chemistry, biochemistry, general biology, human anatomy, and human physiology. Courses taken more than five years ago may need to be repeated. All prerequisite courses must be completed with a grade of 'C' or better.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (MS) in Nutrition Sciences is a research degree that prepares students for careers in research, academia and industry or for doctoral study. The mission of the MS in Nutrition Sciences program is to prepare graduates to translate research into practice to improve health and well-being. This mission is accomplished by emphasizing evidence-based nutrition science, developing skills for critical analysis of nutrition research, and providing opportunities for participation in innovative research.
ScholarshipAmount: $1,000 to several thousand dollars per semester

ProgramName: Doctor of Science in Occupational Therapy (Army-Baylor)
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Fees: There are no tuition or fees for students. Students are active duty officers in the U.S. Army and receive full salary and benefits.
Description: The Army-Baylor University Doctor of Science in Occupational Therapy program's mission is to produce highly skilled, autonomous, evidence-based occupational therapists who are prepared to serve as leaders in the United States military health system. We train military officers to be leaders and advanced clinical practitioners in the field of Occupational Therapy. Our graduates are problem solvers, change agents, and skilled in treating the physical, cognitive, and mental health needs of soldiers and their families. Our students gain advanced clinical skills as practitioners with an emphasis on research. The unique mission of the military occupational therapist requires that our students graduate with an advanced clinical skill set. This program provides the training and research skills to ensure that our students meet this requirement.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Science in Occupational Therapy Program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA), located at 6116 Executive Boulevard, Suite 200, North Bethesda, MD 20852-4929. ACOTE's telephone number, c/o AOTA, is (301) 652-AOTA, and its web address is www.acoteonline.org.

ProgramName: Doctor of Occupational Therapy
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from an approved test of English proficiency. The Baylor Graduate School accepts the TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo English Test, and PTE Academic. Minimum scores of 80 on the iBT, 550 on the pBT, or 213 on the cBT are required for the TOEFL. A minimum overall score of 6.5 is required for the IELTS. A minimum score of 110 is required for the Duolingo English Test. A minimum score of 60 is required for the PTE Academic. Applicants who have completed level 112 of the ELS Language Centers' English for Academic Purposes program will be considered to have met the English proficiency requirement.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) is an entry-level doctoral degree program that prepares students to become registered occupational therapists. The Baylor OTD is a full-time, 24-month, hybrid program. The hybrid learning model combines the best of online learning with hands-on immersion labs held on campus in Waco, Texas. Students complete their didactic coursework through an interactive online platform and travel to campus for face-to-face instruction and skills training in the immersion labs. Students also complete Level I and Level II Fieldwork in their local communities and a 14-week Capstone project in an area of interest.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy doctoral degree program has applied for accreditation and has been granted Candidacy Status by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA), located at 6116 Executive Boulevard, Suite 200, North Bethesda, MD 20852-4929. ACOTE’s telephone number c/o AOTA is (301) 652-AOTA and its Web address is www.acoteonline.org. The program must have a preaccreditation review, complete an on-site evaluation, and be granted Accreditation Status before its graduates will be eligible to sit for the national certification examination for the occupational therapist administered by the National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy (NBCOT). After successful completion of this exam, the individual will be an Occupational Therapist, Registered (OTR).
ScholarshipType: Robbins College scholarships, Baylor Graduate School scholarships, external scholarships, and assistantships

ProgramName: Certificate in Occupational Therapy-Hybrid Teaching
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, the Graduate School requires an official score on one of the following English language proficiency exams: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Hybrid Teaching Certificate is a 12-credit hour program designed for occupational therapists who desire to gain foundational knowledge and skills in teaching in a hybrid-learning environment. The certificate includes content on learning theories, curriculum design and development, instructional methods and assessment, and innovative teaching technologies. Throughout the program, students will engage in active-learning experiences and assignments focused on applying teaching and learning principles. The certificate culminates with a capstone project in which students work closely with a faculty mentor to design and deliver an instructional module in the hybrid OTD program.

ProgramName: Certificate in Online Teaching and Learning
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score to demonstrate English proficiency. Baylor accepts the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Online Teaching and Learning is an 18-hour graduate certificate that prepares individuals to design, develop, deliver, and manage online learning environments in a variety of contexts, including P-12 schools, higher education, corporate, and military settings. This certificate can be completed as a stand-alone certificate or in conjunction with a graduate degree. The Online Teaching and Learning Certificate does not result in a teaching certification.

ProgramName: Doctor of Science in Physical Therapy (Orthopaedic Physical Therapy - Brooke Army-Baylor)
Requirements: The program is open to active duty Army, Navy, and Air Force physical therapists, as well as physical therapists from the Department of Veterans Affairs and other federal agencies. Applicants will complete the application packet as required by their respective branch of service. For more information regarding application requirements, contact your branch corps chief office or federal agency representative.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Fees: This is a fully-funded program. Students do not pay tuition and receive a stipend during the didactic portion of the curriculum.
Description: This nationally ranked Doctor of Science in Physical Therapy (DScPT) program in Orthopaedic Manual Physical Therapy is a 18-month, post-professional degree for licensed physical therapists in the U.S. Military. Students develop into advanced physical therapy practitioners, educators, and researchers, skilled in critical inquiry and evidence-based practice. Graduates are prepared as clinical scientists who can function in academic, research, and clinical settings and are poised to serve as leaders in the Military and in the physical therapy profession. The DScPT curriculum consists of 66 semester hours of didactic and clinical coursework. The first 12 months is primarily didactic instruction and advanced clinical mentorship where students refine their clinical reasoning and manual therapy skills at the Brooke Army Medical Center in San Antonio, Texas. The last 6 months is a clinical fellowship and research dissertation at one of our multiple military sites across the country. DScPT graduates are eligible to sit for the Orthopaedic Clinical Specialist (OCS) examination administered by the American Board of Physical Therapy Specialties and are recognized as a Fellow in the American Academy of Orthopaedic Manual Physical Therapists (FAAOMPT).
MinimumGreScore: 150 on verbal, 150 on quantitative, 3.5 on analytical writing

ProgramName: PhD in P-12 Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor accepts the following as proof: A bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution or from an institution in a country where English is the official language; OR The Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 80 (iBT) or 550 (PBT); OR The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum overall score of 6.5; OR The Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum overall score of 60; OR The Duolingo English Test with a minimum overall score of 110.
Requirements: The application requires: A completed online application and application fee. Transcripts. Resume/CV. Statement of Purpose. 3 letters of recommendation. Writing Sample. Copy of Teaching Certificate. Copy of Principal or Superintendent Certificate (if applicable). Official TOEFL or IELTS scores (for international applicants).
Concentration: higher education, curriculum and instruction, and public policy
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) program in P-12 Educational Leadership is designed to prepare highly qualified researchers and practitioners who can become professors, research associates, and leaders in schools, districts, and other educational organizations. The PhD in P-12 Educational Leadership seeks to balance theory and practice through a rigorous curriculum that includes cognate concentrations in areas such as higher education, curriculum and instruction, and public policy, as well as a rich apprenticeship. The degree requires a minimum of 60 semester hours beyond the master's degree and requires a dissertation.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Pediatric Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a score from one of the following tests is required: TOEFL (minimum 80 on iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum 110). An applicant is exempt from the English proficiency test requirement if they have completed a bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited U.S. institution.
Requirements: Complete the online Graduate School application and pay the non-refundable $50 application fee. An official transcript from each institution attended is required. An official score from TOEFL or IELTS is required if English is not your first language. Three letters of recommendation are required (one from a current or recent immediate supervisor, one from a peer nurse, and one from a MSN, DNP, or PhD prepared nurse). A Personal Statement and a Resume or curriculum vitae are also required. A recorded interview will be required for invited applicants. Additional requirements include: BSN from a nationally accredited nursing program, a minimum GPA of 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale), a current unencumbered RN license to practice professional nursing in the United States, and successful completion of an undergraduate statistics course with a 'C' or better. A minimum of one-year, full-time RN experience is preferred by the start of the program. The GRE is not required.
